attributes.action: draw the line between public sector and charity provision.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Britain has always had a philanthropic tradition and the Welfare State was never intended to be a cure - all solution to all of societies ills. The role of the voluntary sector was clearly outlined in Bevan's vision to address the 5 giants - so why then does every single service in my local authority appear to rely heavily on public donations ? 

This isn't to deny that many organisations do a great job, recognising local problems and responding with initiatives, though often difficult to maintain. Child protection, health care and policing are all statutory duties, which because of poor economic management over many years, by many administrations, rely on kind - hearted souls, the better off or more generous within communities and the church to piece back together.
